intro: Galium pycnotrichum var. vertesense, commonly known as the Hungarian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and slender stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
